intro: Chabraea daucifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sandwort, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal or arid regions. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens in suitable climates.
